intro: Gouania scandens subsp. glandulosa, commonly known as the glandular gouania, is a climbing shrub native to Central and South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family and is characterized by its hairy, glandular stems and leaves. The plant produces small, yellowish flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. Its leaves are usually ovate to elliptic in shape and have a rough texture. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in shaded, moist forest understories.
